# Arpeggio: add2 in E (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is an E add2 chord played using the C shape on the guitar. An add2 chord is essentially a triad chord with an added second note from the scale, in this case, the F# note. When played as an arpeggio, it gives a unique and ethereal sound due to the addition of the second note.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- F# (Second/Add2)
- G# (Major Third)
- B (Fifth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, played in the context of a C-shaped chord, is often used in genres like pop, rock, and even jazz. Its sound is dreamy, peaceful, and adds a sense of color to the chord progression. The added second brings a touch of tension and resolution when used effectively in music.

## 3 Songs
Here are 3 songs that utilize the E add2 arpeggio in the C shape:
1. **"Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin**: The iconic acoustic intro of this classic rock song features arpeggios with add2 chords creating a mystical and enchanting ambiance.
2. **"Over the Hills and Far Away" by Nightwish**: This symphonic metal track incorporates arpeggios with add2 chords to bring out a rich and dynamic sound in the guitar parts.
3. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: In this smooth jazz-pop song, you can hear the E add2 arpeggio used subtly in the piano accompaniment, enhancing the emotive quality of the music.

These songs showcase how the E add2 arpeggio in the C shape can be applied creatively in various musical genres to evoke different moods and textures in a composition.
